alert.note: Alert for Stillwater; Yellowstone (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 15 at 6:10AM MDT until June 16 at 6:03AM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Montana... Yellowstone River at Billings affecting Stillwater and Yellowstone Counties. .The river is expected to begin to recede this morning, falling below flood stage this evening in Billings. It will take until Thursday morning for flooding to recede over far eastern Yellowstone county. For the Yellowstone River...including Billings...Major flooding is occurring. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Yellowstone River at Billings. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:00 AM MDT Wednesday the stage was 16.2 feet. This stage may be affected by flooding and debris at the gauge location resulting in a higher reading. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:00 AM MDT Wednesday was 16.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is cresting this morning. It will then fall below flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 13.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.0 feet on 06/12/1997. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 am) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Yellowstone River Billings 13.5 16.2 Wed 5 am 11.7 10.0 9.8 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Do not drive on or attempt to cross flooded roads, find an alternate route. Roads and driveways may be damaged or washed out in places. Safety message...A river Flood Warning means river flooding is expected to impact people and property in the warned area. Prepare for flooding impacts associated with the forecast river levels in your location. Please report observed flooding to local emergency officials and request they pass the information to the National Weather Service in Billings. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. The latest stages and forecasts for rivers and streams can be found at our web page: water.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued bythis evening at 630 PM MDT.
